title: Bug 12906[Editor Mgmt] Cannot open file in another editor if it is already opened in one editor (should give error message)
description: Bug 12906[Editor Mgmt] If file is already opened in one editor, cannot open in another editor (should give error message)
OB: When a file is opened in one editor, if the user tries to open the same file in another editor by right clicking on the file and selecting 'Open With .. System Editor', nothing happens.
EB: When a file is already opened in one editor, if the user tries to open the same file in another editor by right clicking on the file and selecting 'Open With .. System Editor', a warning message should be displayed stating that the file may be overwritten and asking the user if they want to continue.
SR:
1. Make sure you have a associated Windows editor for your java file. If not, go to the file explorer, double click on any java file, and select WordPad or Notepad as the default editor for all java files. 
2. In the Java Perspective, right click on the java file and select 'Open With .. System Editor'. A Notepad or WordPad window will pop up with the java file opened. Close it. 
3. Go back to the Java Perspective and double click on a java file to open it. 
4. Right click on the java file and select 'Open With .. System Editor'. 

Expected Result: A warning message should be displayed stating that the file may be overwritten and asking the user if they want to continue.
